tarrecords¶

dlinputs.tarrecords.base_plus_ext(fname)[source]¶

Splits pathnames into the file basename plus the extension.

dlinputs.tarrecords.decoder(decode=True)[source]¶

Apply tariterator-like decoding to the stream of samples.

dlinputs.tarrecords.dir_plus_file(fname)[source]¶

Splits pathnames into the dirname plus the filename.

dlinputs.tarrecords.group_by_keys(keys=<function base_plus_ext>, lcase=True)[source]¶

Groups key, value pairs into samples.

dlinputs.tarrecords.last_dir(fname)[source]¶

Splits pathnames into the last dir plus the filename.

dlinputs.tarrecords.splitallext(path)[source]¶

Helper method that splits off all extension.

Returns base, allext.

Parameters:path – path with extensions
Returns:path with all extensions removed
dlinputs.tarrecords.tardata(fileobj)[source]¶

Iterator yielding filename, content pairs for the given tar stream.

dlinputs.tarrecords.tariterator(fileobj, check_sorted=False, keys=<function base_plus_ext>, decode=True, source=None, lcase=True)[source]¶

Iterate over samples from a tar archive, either locally or given by URL.

Tar archives are assumed to be sorted by file name. For each basename, reads all the files with different extensions and returns a dictionary with the extension as key and the file contents as value.

Parameters:
  • archive (str) – tar archive with sorted file names (file name or URL)
  • check_sorted (bool) – verify that file names are sorted
Returns:

iterator over samples
dlinputs.tarrecords.tariterator1(fileobj, check_sorted=False, keys=<function base_plus_ext>, decode=True)[source]¶

Alternative (new) implementation of tariterator.

dlinputs.tarrecords.zipdata(fname)[source]¶

Iterator yielding filename, content pairs for the given zip file.
